item.description: • An SUV, or Sport Utility Vehicle, is a large vehicle that is designed for off-road use • SUVs typically have four-wheel drive and a higher ground clearance than other vehicles, making them ideal for driving in rough or uneven terrain • Some SUVs also have features like a built-in navigation system and a spacious interior that make them perfect for road trips and family vacations

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Transmission fluid definition and meaning
item.description: • Transmission fluid is the lifeblood of your transmission • It keeps all of the moving parts inside clean and well-lubricated, allowing them to move smoothly and efficiently • Over time, though, the fluid can become dirty and degraded, leading to problems with your transmission

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Department of Transportation (DOT) definition and meaning
item.description: • DOT is an abbreviation for the United States Department of Transportation • A DOT code is a series of numbers and letters that indicate when a tire was manufactured, as well as its size, load capacity and speed rating • The first two digits after the DOT symbol represent the week of the year that the tire was made, while the last two digits represent the year

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Anti-theft immobilizer definition and meaning
item.description: • An anti-theft immobilizer is a device installed in a car to prevent it from being stolen • This system prevents the vehicle from being started without the proper key • Most modern cars have some form of anti-theft immobilizer fitted as standard

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Anti-theft codes definition and meaning
item.description: • Anti-theft codes are designed to prevent your car from being stolen • These codes are special sequences of numbers or letters that are required in order to start a car • They are typically stored in the engine control unit (ECU) and can only be accessed by authorized personnel

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Pyrometer definition and meaning
item.description: • A pyrometer is a device that measures the temperature of an object • It is commonly used in tires to measure the temperature of the tread and sidewall • The data from a pyrometer can be used to monitor tire wear, identify tire problems, and adjust tire pressure

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Carbon fiber definition and meaning
item.description: • Carbon fiber is a strong, lightweight material that is used in a variety of applications • It is made from carbon atoms that are bonded together to form a long chain • The resulting material is very strong and can be used to create everything from sports equipment to airplane parts

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">M+S tires definition and meaning
item.description: • Mud and snow tires are designed to provide better traction in adverse conditions, including mud, snow, and ice • They are commonly abbreviated as M+S or M/S on a tire’s sidewall • These tires typically have deeper treads than regular tires and may also feature special compounds and tread patterns that help to improve grip

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Dynamic balance definition and meaning
item.description: • Dynamic balance is the process of equalizing the distribution of mass around a wheel or tire’s rotational axis • This ensures that there is no unbalanced force acting on the wheel or tire as it rotates, which can cause vibration and premature wear • The dynamic balance process involves attaching weights to the wheel or tire at specific points to offset any imbalance

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Carbon monoxide definition and meaning
item.description: • Carbon monoxide (CO) is a gas that is produced when fuel is burned • It is a by-product of combustion and can be found in car exhaust fumes, cigarette smoke, and fuel-burning appliances such as furnaces, stoves, and water heaters • When inhaled, carbon monoxide prevents the blood from carrying oxygen to the body’s tissues and organs

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Seating capacity definition and meaning
item.description: • The seating capacity of cars varies depending on the make and model • Seats in a car can be either bucket seats or bench seats • Bucket seats are individual seats that are separate from each other, while bench seats are one long seat that runs along the length of the car

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Tire antioxidants definition and meaning
item.description: • Tire antioxidants help preserve the rubber in your tires, keeping them looking new and improving their lifespan • Over time, exposure to oxygen and other elements can cause tire rubber to degrade, resulting in cracks, splits, and eventually failure • Antioxidants work by forming a barrier between the rubber and the air, slowing the oxidation process and protecting your tires.

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">B-pillar definition and meaning
item.description: • A B-pillar is the support structure between the side windows of a vehicle • The B-pillar typically contains the door latch and is often reinforced with additional structural elements to improve safety during a collision • Depending on the vehicle’s design, the B-pillar may also house other features such as speakers or storage pockets

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Highway fuel economy definition and meaning
item.description: • Highway fuel economy is a measure of how efficiently a vehicle uses fuel while traveling on highways • The higher the highway fuel economy, the less fuel the vehicle consumes and the more miles it can travel on a gallon of gasoline • Highway fuel economy is important to consider when choosing a vehicle because it can save you money at the pump and help reduce your carbon footprint

item.title: <span style="font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 18px;">Catalytic converter heat shield definition and meaning
item.description: • A catalytic converter heat shield is a device that helps to protect the catalytic converter from excessive heat • The heat shield helps to keep the converter cool by shielding it from the hot exhaust gases • This allows the converter to work more efficiently and last longer
